p.s: Sonnet 138 by William ShakespearShakespeare, describes how the speaker relizes his/her aging process whereas his/her adressedaddressed love denies it.
In the end the speaker claims that he/she wants to ignore worrying about aging and just enjoy and keep on loving the love the speaker has for the adressedaddressed person.
The first quatrain contains that the adressedaddressed person claims to be honest on every subject but the speaker knows tha he/she does not tell the truth about everything.
For example, he/she denies the speaker's aging process.
The speaker also speculates if his/her love thinks he/she has not experienced his/her youth that much.
The second quatrain continues with saying that the adresseaddressee ineffectually believes that the speaker is young and is still in his youth.
Furthermore, the speaker explains that he/she knows how the adresseaddressee thinks about his/her glorious days, of being able to do anything as a human being are over.
The speaker concludes how on both sides, the speaker as well as the adresseaddressee are suppressing the truth.
In the last quatrain the speaker questions why both parties keep lying to each other.
He/she believes that trust is the most important habit in a relationship.
Therefore, the speaker realizes that people in ana unforced and loving relationship do not want to remaindremind themselves of their age and the time they have left.
The couplet summarizes how the speaker will continue to love the adressedaddressed person even with their flaws.
